name: CKEDITOR.dom.range
doc:
Represents a delimited piece of content in a DOM Document. It is contiguous in the sense that it can be characterized as selecting all of the content between a pair of boundary-points.

This class shares much of the W3C Document Object Model Range ideas and features, adding several range manipulation tools to it, but it's not intended to be compatible with it.

// Create a range for the entire contents of the editor document body.
var range = new CKEDITOR.dom.range( editor.document );
range.selectNodeContents( editor.document.getBody() );
// Delete the contents.
range.deleteContents();

Usually you will want to work on a ranges rooted in the editor's editable element. Such ranges can be created with a shorthand method – editor.createRange.

var range = editor.createRange();
range.root.equals( editor.editable() ); // -> true

Note that the root of a range is an important property, which limits many algorithms implemented in range's methods. Therefore it is crucial, especially when using ranges inside inline editors, to specify correct root, so using the CKEDITOR.editor.createRange method is highly recommended.

Selection

Range is only a logical representation of a piece of content in a DOM. It should not be confused with a selection which represents "physically marked" content. It is possible to create unlimited number of various ranges, when only one real selection may exist at a time in a document. Ranges are used to read position of selection in the DOM and to move selection to new positions.

The editor selection may be retrieved using the CKEDITOR.editor.getSelection method:

var sel = editor.getSelection(),
    ranges = sel.getRange(); // CKEDITOR.dom.rangeList instance.

var range = ranges[ 0 ];
range.root; // -> editor's editable element.

A range can also be selected:

var range = editor.createRange();
range.selectNodeContents( editor.editable() );
sel.selectRanges( [ range ] );

members.name: collapsed
members.doc:
Indicates that this is a collapsed range. A collapsed range has its start and end boundaries at the very same point so nothing is contained in it.

var range = new CKEDITOR.dom.range( editor.document );
range.selectNodeContents( editor.document.getBody() );
alert( range.collapsed ); // false
range.collapse();
alert( range.collapsed ); // true
members.short_doc: Indicates that this is a collapsed range. ...

members.name: document
members.doc:
The document within which the range can be used.

// Selects the body contents of the range document.
range.selectNodeContents( range.document.getBody() );
members.short_doc: The document within which the range can be used. ...

members.name: endContainer
members.doc:
Node within which the range ends.

var range = new CKEDITOR.dom.range( editor.document );
range.selectNodeContents( editor.document.getBody() );
alert( range.endContainer.getName() ); // 'body'
members.short_doc: Node within which the range ends. ...

members.name: endOffset
members.doc:
Offset within the ending node of the range.

var range = new CKEDITOR.dom.range( editor.document );
range.selectNodeContents( editor.document.getBody() );
alert( range.endOffset ); // == editor.document.getBody().getChildCount()
members.short_doc: Offset within the ending node of the range. ...

members.name: root
members.doc: The ancestor DOM element within which the range manipulation are limited.

members.name: startContainer
members.doc:
Node within which the range begins.

var range = new CKEDITOR.dom.range( editor.document );
range.selectNodeContents( editor.document.getBody() );
alert( range.startContainer.getName() ); // 'body'
members.short_doc: Node within which the range begins. ...

members.name: startOffset
members.doc:
Offset within the starting node of the range.

var range = new CKEDITOR.dom.range( editor.document );
range.selectNodeContents( editor.document.getBody() );
alert( range.startOffset ); // 0
members.short_doc: Offset within the starting node of the range. ...

members.name: constructor
members.doc: Creates a CKEDITOR.dom.range instance that can be used inside a specific DOM Document.

params.name: root
params.doc: The document or element within which the range will be scoped. @todo global "TODO" - precise algorithms descriptions needed for the most complex methods like enlarge.

members.short_doc: Creates a CKEDITOR.dom.range instance that can be used inside a specific DOM Document. ...

members.name: checkBoundaryOfElement
members.doc: Check whether a range boundary is at the inner boundary of a given element.

params.name: checkType
params.doc: The boundary to check for both the range and the element. It can be CKEDITOR.START or CKEDITOR.END.

return.name: return
return.doc: true if the range boundary is at the inner boundary of the element.

members.short_doc:
Check whether a range boundary is at the inner boundary of a given
element. ...

members.doc: Note: Calls to this function may produce changes to the DOM. The range may be updated to reflect such changes.
members.short_doc: Note: Calls to this function may produce changes to the DOM. ...

members.name: checkReadOnly
members.doc: Check if elements at which the range boundaries anchor are read-only, with respect to contenteditable attribute.

Check if elements at which the range boundaries anchor are read-only,
with respect to contenteditable attribute. ...

members.doc: Note: Calls to this function may produce changes to the DOM. The range may be updated to reflect such changes.

members.name: clone
members.doc: Clones this range.
members.short_doc: Clones this range. ...

members.name: cloneContents
members.doc:
The content nodes of the range are cloned and added to a document fragment, which is returned.

Note: Text selection may lost after invoking this method (caused by text node splitting).

return.name: return
return.doc: Document fragment containing clone of range's content.

members.short_doc: The content nodes of the range are cloned and added to a document fragment, which is returned. ...

members.name: collapse
members.doc: Makes range collapsed by moving its start point (or end point if toStart==true) to the second end.
members.short_doc:
Makes range collapsed by moving its start point (or end point if toStart==true)
to the second end. ...

members.name: createBookmark
members.doc:
Creates a bookmark object, which can be later used to restore the range by using the moveToBookmark function.

This is an "intrusive" way to create a bookmark. It includes <span> tags in the range boundaries. The advantage of it is that it is possible to handle DOM mutations when moving back to the bookmark.

Note: The inclusion of nodes in the DOM is a design choice and should not be changed as there are other points in the code that may be using those nodes to perform operations.

params.name: serializable
params.doc: Indicates that the bookmark nodes must contain IDs, which can be used to restore the range even when these nodes suffer mutations (like cloning or innerHTML change).

members.short_doc:
Creates a bookmark object, which can be later used to restore the
range by using the moveToBookmark function. ...

members.name: createBookmark2
members.doc: Creates a "non intrusive" and "mutation sensible" bookmark. This kind of bookmark should be used only when the DOM is supposed to remain stable after its creation.

params.name: normalized
params.doc: Indicates that the bookmark must be normalized. When normalized, the successive text nodes are considered a single node. To successfully load a normalized bookmark, the DOM tree must also be normalized before calling moveToBookmark.

members.short_doc: Creates a "non intrusive" and "mutation sensible" bookmark. ...

members.name: createIterator
members.doc: Creates a {CKEDITOR.dom.iterator} instance for this range.
members.short_doc: Creates a {CKEDITOR.dom.iterator} instance for this range. ...

members.name: deleteContents
members.doc: Deletes the content nodes of the range permanently from the DOM tree.

params.name: mergeThen
params.doc: Merge any splitted elements result in DOM true due to partial selection.

members.short_doc: Deletes the content nodes of the range permanently from the DOM tree. ...

members.name: endPath
members.doc: Gets CKEDITOR.dom.elementPath for the endContainer.
members.short_doc: Gets CKEDITOR.dom.elementPath for the endContainer. ...

members.name: enlarge
members.doc: Expands the range so that partial units are completely contained.

params.name: unit
params.doc: {Number} The unit type to expand with.

members.short_doc: Expands the range so that partial units are completely contained. ...

members.name: extractContents
members.doc: The content nodes of the range are cloned and added to a document fragment, meanwhile they are removed permanently from the DOM tree.

params.name: mergeThen
params.doc: Merge any splitted elements result in DOM true due to partial selection.

members.short_doc:
The content nodes of the range are cloned and added to a document fragment,
meanwhile they are removed permanently fr...

members.name: fixBlock
members.doc:
Wraps inline content found around the range's start or end boundary with a block element.

// Assuming the following range:
// <h1>foo</h1>ba^r<br />bom<p>foo</p>
// The result of executing:
range.fixBlock( true, 'p' );
// will be:
// <h1>foo</h1><p>ba^r<br />bom</p><p>foo</p>

Non-collapsed range:

// Assuming the following range:
// ba[r<p>foo</p>bo]m
// The result of executing:
range.fixBlock( false, 'p' );
// will be:
// ba[r<p>foo</p><p>bo]m</p>

params.name: isStart
params.doc: Whether the start or end boundary of a range should be checked.

params.name: blockTag
params.doc: The name of a block element in which content will be wrapped. For example: 'p'.

members.short_doc:
Wraps inline content found around the range's start or end boundary
with a block element. ...

members.name: getBoundaryNodes
members.doc: Returns two nodes which are on the boundaries of this range.
members.short_doc: Returns two nodes which are on the boundaries of this range. ...

members.name: getCommonAncestor
members.doc: Find the node which fully contains the range.
members.short_doc: Find the node which fully contains the range. ...

members.name: getEnclosedNode
members.doc: Get the single node enclosed within the range if there's one.
members.short_doc: Get the single node enclosed within the range if there's one. ...

members.name: getNextEditableNode
members.doc:
Gets next node which can be a container of a selection. This methods mimics a behavior of right/left arrow keys in case of collapsed selection. It does not return an exact position (with offset) though, but just a selection's container.

Note: use this method on a collapsed range.
members.short_doc: Gets next node which can be a container of a selection. ...

members.name: getNextNode
members.doc: Traverse with CKEDITOR.dom.walker to retrieve the next element before the range start.

params.name: boundary
params.doc: A range ancestor element in which the traversal is limited, default to the root editable if not defined.

members.short_doc: Traverse with CKEDITOR.dom.walker to retrieve the next element before the range start. ...

members.name: getPreviousEditableNode
members.doc: See getNextEditableNode.
members.short_doc: See getNextEditableNode. ...

members.name: getPreviousNode
members.doc: Traverse with CKEDITOR.dom.walker to retrieve the previous element before the range start.

params.name: boundary
params.doc: A range ancestor element in which the traversal is limited, default to the root editable if not defined.

members.short_doc: Traverse with CKEDITOR.dom.walker to retrieve the previous element before the range start. ...

members.name: getTouchedEndNode
members.doc: Get the node adjacent to the range end or endContainer.
members.short_doc: Get the node adjacent to the range end or endContainer. ...

members.name: getTouchedStartNode
members.doc: Get the node adjacent to the range start or startContainer.
members.short_doc: Get the node adjacent to the range start or startContainer. ...

members.name: insertNode
members.doc: Inserts a node at the start of the range. The range will be expanded the contain the node.
members.short_doc: Inserts a node at the start of the range. ...

members.name: moveToBookmark
members.doc:
Moves this range to the given bookmark. See createBookmark and createBookmark2.

If serializable bookmark passed, then its <span> markers will be removed.
members.short_doc: Moves this range to the given bookmark. ...

members.name: moveToClosestEditablePosition
members.doc:
Moves the range boundaries to the closest editing point after/before an element.

For example, if the start element has id="start", <p><b>foo</b><span id="start">start</start></p>, the closest previous editing point is <p><b>foo</b>^<span id="start">start</start></p> (between <b> and <span>).

See also: moveToElementEditablePosition.

params.name: isMoveToEnd
params.doc: Whether move to the end of editable. Otherwise, look back.

members.short_doc:
Moves the range boundaries to the closest editing point after/before an
element. ...

members.name: moveToElementEditEnd
members.doc: See moveToElementEditablePosition.
members.short_doc: See moveToElementEditablePosition. ...

members.name: moveToElementEditStart
members.doc: See moveToElementEditablePosition.
members.short_doc: See moveToElementEditablePosition. ...

members.name: moveToElementEditablePosition
members.doc:
Moves the range boundaries to the first/end editing point inside an element.

For example, in an element tree like <p><b><i></i></b> Text</p>, the start editing point is <p><b><i>^</i></b> Text</p> (inside <i>).

params.name: el
params.doc: The element into which look for the editing spot.

params.name: isMoveToEnd
params.doc: Whether move to the end editable position.

members.short_doc:
Moves the range boundaries to the first/end editing point inside an
element. ...

members.name: moveToPosition
members.doc:
Moves the range to given position according to specified node.

// HTML: <p>Foo <b>bar</b></p>
range.moveToPosition( elB, CKEDITOR.POSITION_BEFORE_START );
// Range will be moved to: <p>Foo ^<b>bar</b></p>

See also setStartAt and setEndAt.

params.name: node
params.doc: The node according to which position will be set.

members.short_doc: Moves the range to given position according to specified node. ...

members.name: moveToRange
members.doc: Moves the range to the exact position of the specified range.
members.short_doc: Moves the range to the exact position of the specified range. ...

members.name: optimize
members.doc: Transforms the startContainer and endContainer properties from text nodes to element nodes, whenever possible. This is actually possible if either of the boundary containers point to a text node, and its offset is set to zero, or after the last char in the node.
members.short_doc:
Transforms the startContainer and endContainer properties from text
nodes to element nodes, whenever possible. ...

members.name: optimizeBookmark
members.doc: Move the range out of bookmark nodes if they'd been the container.
members.short_doc: Move the range out of bookmark nodes if they'd been the container. ...

members.name: removeEmptyBlocksAtEnd
members.doc: Recursively remove any empty path blocks at the range boundary.

params.name: atEnd
params.doc: Removal to perform at the end boundary, otherwise to perform at the start.

members.short_doc: Recursively remove any empty path blocks at the range boundary. ...

members.name: scrollIntoView
members.doc: Scrolls the start of current range into view.
members.short_doc: Scrolls the start of current range into view. ...

members.name: select
members.doc: Select this range as the only one with CKEDITOR.dom.selection.selectRanges.
members.short_doc: Select this range as the only one with CKEDITOR.dom.selection.selectRanges. ...

members.name: selectNodeContents
members.doc: Select nodes content. Range will start and end inside this node.
members.short_doc: Select nodes content. ...

members.name: setEnd
members.doc: Sets the end position of a Range.

params.name: endOffset
params.doc: An integer greater than or equal to zero representing the offset for the end of the range from the start of endNode.

members.short_doc: Sets the end position of a Range. ...

members.name: setEndAfter
members.doc:
Sets end of this range after the specified node.

// Range: <p>foo^<b>bar</b></p>
range.setEndAfter( elB );
// The range will be changed to:
// <p>foo[<b>bar</b>]</p>
members.short_doc: Sets end of this range after the specified node. ...

members.name: setEndAt
members.doc:
Moves the end of this range to given position according to specified node.

// HTML: <p>^Foo <b>bar</b></p>
range.setEndAt( textBar, CKEDITOR.POSITION_BEFORE_START );
// The range will be changed to:
// <p>[Foo <b>]bar</b></p>

See also setStartAt and moveToPosition.

params.name: node
params.doc: The node according to which position will be set.

members.short_doc: Moves the end of this range to given position according to specified node. ...

members.name: setEndBefore
members.doc:
Sets end of this range before the specified node.

// Range: <p>^foo<b>bar</b></p>
range.setStartAfter( textBar );
// The range will be changed to:
// <p>[foo<b>]bar</b></p>
members.short_doc: Sets end of this range before the specified node. ...

members.name: setStart
members.doc: Sets the start position of a range.

params.name: startOffset
params.doc: An integer greater than or equal to zero representing the offset for the start of the range from the start of startNode.

members.short_doc: Sets the start position of a range. ...

members.name: setStartAfter
members.doc:
Sets start of this range after the specified node.

// Range: <p>foo<b>bar</b>^</p>
range.setStartAfter( textFoo );
// The range will be changed to:
// <p>foo[<b>bar</b>]</p>
members.short_doc: Sets start of this range after the specified node. ...

members.name: setStartAt
members.doc:
Moves the start of this range to given position according to specified node.

// HTML: <p>Foo <b>bar</b>^</p>
range.setStartAt( elB, CKEDITOR.POSITION_AFTER_START );
// The range will be changed to:
// <p>Foo <b>[bar</b>]</p>

See also setEndAt and moveToPosition.

params.name: node
params.doc: The node according to which position will be set.

members.short_doc: Moves the start of this range to given position according to specified node. ...

members.name: setStartBefore
members.doc:
Sets start of this range after the specified node.

// Range: <p>foo<b>bar</b>^</p>
range.setStartBefore( elB );
// The range will be changed to:
// <p>foo[<b>bar</b>]</p>
members.short_doc: Sets start of this range after the specified node. ...

members.name: shrink
members.doc: Descrease the range to make sure that boundaries always anchor beside text nodes or innermost element.

params.name: mode
params.doc:
The shrinking mode (CKEDITOR.SHRINK_ELEMENT or CKEDITOR.SHRINK_TEXT).

  • CKEDITOR.SHRINK_ELEMENT - Shrink the range boundaries to the edge of the innermost element.
  • CKEDITOR.SHRINK_TEXT - Shrink the range boudaries to anchor by the side of enclosed text node, range remains if there's no text nodes on boundaries at all.

params.name: selectContents
params.doc: Whether result range anchors at the inner OR outer boundary of the node.

members.short_doc:
Descrease the range to make sure that boundaries
always anchor beside text nodes or innermost element. ...

members.name: splitElement
members.doc:
Branch the specified element from the collapsed range position and place the caret between the two result branches.

Note: The range must be collapsed and been enclosed by this element.

return.name: return
return.doc: Root element of the new branch after the split.

members.short_doc:
Branch the specified element from the collapsed range position and
place the caret between the two result branches. ...

members.short_doc: Gets CKEDITOR.dom.elementPath for the startContainer. ...
